messageBody:
>> hi,
>>
>> but what's about testing setter-methodes, if in there you're
>> doing some value (-range) checks ?! i think then it make
>> sense to test them ..

>Agreed. The moment the setX() method does anything more than
"this.something =
>something;", it usually becomes worth testing.

maybe right, but during setting some values it's very often necessary to
check any ranges / boundaries ... you don't have to put this code-to-check
it
into the setterXXX methods - but then you may have redudant code !!! and not
to check may lead to undefined state / behavior ...

or i can put the code in a kind of helper method and call this method from
the setterXXX - but that's nothing better i think ?!

so you don't perform such kind of value checks ??
... i'm very interesting in how do you perform value checks ?

gabi
